file_content.text: Excuse me, Master Jedi, but can you bonk this guy on the head? It's the only thing that might make him see reason.
It's Major, right? I'm Shane. You need to talk some sense into your buddy here, or he's going to lose the war.
I can always spot my own! Name's Trigo Shane, help a free trader out and convince this ground-pounder he's got the wrong idea.
Look, I've not seen you around before--name's Shane, Trigo Shane--but maybe you can help me for a second.
You've turned me up a tidy profit, bucko, recovering those weapons. Nice to work with someone trustworthy for a change.
That was big risk grabbing those weapons--Old Bathens here'd never do it--but the payoff's been great!
Your quick thinking has given us a real edge against Imperial assets. Grabbing those weapons was brilliant.
Those snub fighters won't give your men any more trouble, Captain.
Told you it'd work, Bathens! You owe me a hundred credits.
I'll admit, I didn't expect to see you again. I've never been so pleased to be wrong.
With those fighters out of the way, the Republic will have no problem establishing air superiority.
With air support, Republic troops should finally be able to put the Imps on the run.
Hopefully this turns the tide.
Indeed. You've done us a great service, and it's our turn to make sure your efforts aren't wasted.
It wasn't that big a deal.
You may think it's nothing, but you've certainly outdone yourself. Now it's up to us to turn the tide.
You should have attacked the fighters straight away, there's no telling how many lives might have been saved.
Your indecision is dangerous.
There's no way it would have worked without your help. I feel vindicated, regardless.
Thanks for slipping some of those weapons back with you. Those babies will turn a pretty profit, and help shove the Imps out.
Here's a little something for the extra effort, after all, part of the profit's yours.
He's impressed, stick-in-the-mud Bathens just hates to admit a pirate like me was right. Wouldn't have worked without you, though. Thanks.
I've got a bet with Bathens here that you'll pull this off, so hurry up 'cause I'm not interested in losing money.
How many times must we go over this? Any benefits of attacking the spaceport aren't worth the cost in lives.
Open your eyes, Captain. It's the only way to keep the Imps from wiping you out.
I'll have to understand what's going on before I can help.
What seems to be the problem?
It's nothing to concern you, really.
Tell the truth Bathens! Tell them you'd rather watch Imp starfighters shred your men than take a risk and attack their hangars.
I don't think we've been introduced.
I'm sorry, who are you?
It's all right, Master Shane is supposed to be here. He's providing a "freelance" perspective on fighting the Empire's troops.
I'm providing, but you're not listening! Every battle, Imperial starfighters mutilate his troops--I know where they're parked but he won't attack.
You're talking about the best defended hangars on Corellia.
You can't talk to a ranking Republic officer like that.
Show the captain some respect.
He's rank like a wet bantha. He's got a chance to save his men's lives but won't take it.
That's enough! I will put up with your harassment of me, mercenary, but do not drag other parties into it.
Listen, every time he attacks, Imperial starfighters butcher his men. Taking out their starfighters would solve the problem, but he won't!
You don't even need a frontal assault; nasty enough team could slip into the starport and blow those ships under the Imps' noses.
I'll do it. I can handle a starport assault.
Where do I sign up?
You're not under my command so I can't order you to stand down, but my opinion is clear.
If you're committed to this folly, we do have demolitions charges. Placed correctly, they'll bring down the hangars onto the fighters.
If that's all it takes, why hasn't anyone destroyed them before now?
You almost make it sound easy.
The starport has elite troops and Sith guarding it; a squad might get inside but they'd be discovered in moments.
I think you're both nuts.
Don't walk away! You know what the Empire means to people like us; if we don't take a stand we're out of work.
I don't make big speeches, that's for officers. We both know the score, are you helping us or yourself?
Look, I'm just a ship-captain, but even I see that Corellia's the key. If it falls, eventually, the galaxy goes too.
All my infiltration teams were wiped out weeks ago. I've got no one capable of doing the job.
Officially I'm an advisor, I can't ask you to do anything. But we both know if those starfighters are gone, the troops will have a fighting chance.
It's my duty to help turn back the Empire.
I'm honored to help.
I don't know about duty, for me it's just good business.
Cloaked in the Force, I will have no problem entering their spaceport.
It will be easy for me.
I don't follow that mystical mumbo-jumbo, but if it works for you then I say go for it.
Infiltration and sabotage are my bread and butter, just watch.
This is what I do best.
Sounds like you're perfect for the job.
From one trader to another, I'll handle this. But you owe me.
I'll do it--we'll swap favors.
I've got just the way to make it up to you--I've stripped my share of weapons in my day.
Use this gunripper and pull some of those Imperial weapons. They'll give the Republic an edge and we'll turn a tidy profit.
When you're done, or if it gets too hot, just set the charges and get out. No one'll be any wiser.
Okay already, I'll do it.
Use these demolitions charges on the structural supports; they'll collapse the hangers onto the fighters.
Hey, take this gunripper too. I used it to pry weapons off, ah, pirate ships we raided on the Rimma.
The Imps have some fancy toys on their fighters; if you can bring some back, we can put them to good use.
I won't. [Refuse quest]
I'm glad to see someone else has some appreciation for the proper way. Maybe now he'll stop hounding me about it.
I'm right, and you know it. You can't blame me wanting to win the war, instead of waiting to get shot to pieces.
You're a cold eel, standing around while the Imps rip your men to shreds. Especially when you know I've got a solution.
I've already told you, your plan is out of the question. We simply don't have the resources.
I'll concede that the idea was sound. With the fighters out of the way, the Republic has less to fear on the ground.
Ha! Admit I'm right you old warhorse, it's the least you can do after we saved your hide.
